Pricing Overview

At Hazel Family Law & Mediation, we understand that navigating family law issues is challenging enough, and finding the right lawyer should not add unnecessary financial stress. That is why the first 30 minutes of your initial interview with us is free of charge.

During your first appointment we will work with you to:

  • Understand your situation and desired outcome;
  • Identify your key issues and provide you with clear and practical advice; and
  • Plan a pathway forward

Your appointment can take place in person at our Melbourne CBD office, via Microsoft Teams or by telephone.

You may choose to end the interview after the complimentary 30 minutes or continue to receive tailored advice.

A comprehensive initial appointment typically lasts around one hour. Any time beyond the first 30 minutes is charged at Elisa’s regular hourly rate, payable at the conclusion of your appointment.

We aim to provide you with the clarity and confidence to make well-informed decisions and plan your next steps, guided by our practical and experienced advice.

If you choose to move forward with us by your side, then we can outline the likely costs involved in helping you achieve a resolution.

Moving Forward

We understand that no one likes paying legal fees, and the longer a matter remains unresolved, the more stressful and burdensome those growing costs can feel.

Whenever possible, we will tailor our services to suit your budget and provide clear, practical guidance on how to manage and contain your family law costs.

We also understand the financial strain many clients experience. Please speak with us about the various funding options available. Do not let finances get in the way of resolving your situation.

Together, we can help you navigate your way to a successful outcome.



Litigation Funding

One option for meeting your legal costs is by way of a litigation funder. We have partnered with JustFund - Australia’s only dedicated provider of funding solutions for family law legal fees. Through our partnership, eligible clients can access a flexible line of credit to help manage legal fees and expenses, with nothing to repay until after a settlement is reached. Unlike traditional lenders, JustFund does not look at income or credit scores to approve funding support for family law matters.

Contact us for more information about JustFund, or feel free to contact them directly.
